headerText: The `v-alert` component is used to convey important information to the user through the use contextual types icons and color. These default types come in in 4 variations: **success**, **info**, **warning** and **error**. Default icons are assigned which help represent different actions each type portrays. Many parts of an alert such as `border`, `icon`, and `color` can also be customized to fit almost any situation

usage.desc: Alerts in their simplist form displays a message with default theme and style.

dismissible.desc: The `dismissible` prop adds a close button to the end of the alert component. Clicking this button will set its value to false and effectively hide the alert. You can restore the alert by binding `v-model` and setting it to true.

icon.desc: You can easily assign a custom icon or remove it altogether.

transition.desc: You can apply a custom transition to the show/hide of the alert.

outline.desc: Outline alerts inherit their borders from the current color applied.

props.border: Puts a border on the element. Accepts **top** | **right** | **bottom** | **left**
props.coloredBorder: Swap color from the background to the border for an alternative border look
props.dense: Hides icon for a more simplistic alert
props.dismissible: Specifies that the Alert can be closed
props.prominent: Displays a larger vertically centered icon to draw more attention
props.text: Make the background transparent and color the text
props.type: Specify a **success**, **info**, **warning** or **error** alert. Uses the contextual color and a pre-defined icon.
